user.title: User
user.description: The user that runs the ZooKeeper nodes and owns the Mesos sandbox.

service_account.title: DC/OS Service Account (optional)
service_account.description: The service account for DC/OS service authentication. This is typically left empty to use the default unless service authentication is needed. The value given here is passed as the principal of Mesos framework.

service_account_secret.title: DC/OS Service Account Secret (optional)
service_account_secret.description: Name of the Secret Store credential to use for DC/OS service authentication. This should be left empty unless service authentication is needed.

virtual_network_name.title: Virtual Network Name
virtual_network_name.description: The name of the virtual network to join.

virtual_network_plugin_labels.title: Virtual Network Plugin Labels
virtual_network_plugin_labels.description: Labels to pass to the virtual network plugin. Comma-separated key:value pairs. For example: k_0:v_0,k_1:v_1,...,k_n:v_n

log_level.title: Scheduler Log Level
log_level.description: The log level for the DC/OS service.

mesos_api_version.description: Configures the Mesos API version to use. Possible values: V0 (non-HTTP), V1 (HTTP)

hostname.description: The name or address of a host running a KDC for the realm.

port.description: The port of the host running a KDC for that realm.

primary.description: The Kerberos primary used by ZooKeeper tasks.

realm.description: The Kerberos realm used to render the principal of ZooKeeper tasks.

keytab_secret.description: The name of the DC/OS secret storing the keytab

debug.description: Turn debug Kerberos logging on or off to assist in diagnosing issues with Kerberos authentication.

advanced.description: Advanced Kerberos configuration. These settings can be used to enable or disable Kerberos on a running service. The defaults require full authentication between clients and quorum peers.

required_for_client.description: Require Kerberos authentication for clients. Unauthenticated clients can only ping, create a session, close a session, or SASL-authenticate with the ZooKeeper service (see: requireClientAuthScheme).

required_for_quorum_learner.description: Require Kerberos authentication for quorum peer learners. If this is set to true, a quorum peer learner will send authentication packet to quorum peer servers then proceeds with leader election on successful authentication. If false, the learner procedes with leader election without any authentication.

required_for_quorum_server.description: Require Kerberos authentication for quorum peer servers. If this is set to true, then all unauthenticated quorum peer learner connection requests will be rejected. If false, then quorum peer server will accept quorum peer learner connection request and then proceeds with leader election even if the authentication did not succeed.

count.title: Node count
count.description: Number of ZooKeeper pods to run. CAN ONLY BE 3 OR 5

data_disk.title: Data Disk Size (MB)
data_disk.description: Disk size of device designated for data (MB)

data_disk_type.title: Data Disk Type
data_disk_type.description: Disk type [ROOT, MOUNT] of device designated for data.

log_disk.title: Log Disk Size (MB)
log_disk.description: Disk size of device designated for logging (MB)

log_disk_type.title: Log Disk Type
log_disk_type.description: Disk type [ROOT, MOUNT] of device designated for logging

zookeeper.description: ZooKeeper-specific configuration paramters (for more information, see the ZooKeeper admin docs)

tick_time.title: tickTime
tick_time.description: Length of a single tick, which is the basic time unit used by ZooKeeper

client_port.title: Client port
client_port.description: Client port for host to listen to client frameworks on

follower_port.title: Follower port
follower_port.description: Port followers use to connect to the leader. Same for every node in cluster.

leader_election_port.title: Leader election port
leader_election_port.description: Port used in cluster for leader elections. Same for every node in cluster.

sync_enabled.title: syncEnabled
sync_enabled.description: If sync is enabled, the observers log transaction and write snapshots to disk like the participants do.

sync_limit.title: syncLimit
sync_limit.description: The amount of time, in ticks, to allow followers to sync with the ZooKeeper leader. If followers fall too far behind a leader, they will be dropped.

global_outstanding_limit.title: globalOutstandingLimit
global_outstanding_limit.description: Clients can submit requests faster than ZooKeeper can process them, especially if there are a lot of clients. To prevent ZooKeeper from running out of memory due to queued requests, ZooKeeper will throttle clients so that there is no more than globalOutstandingLimit outstanding requests in the system. The default limit is 1,000.

pre_alloc_size.title: preAllocSize
pre_alloc_size.description: To avoid seeks ZooKeeper allocates space in the transaction log file in blocks of preAllocSize kilobytes. The default block size is 64M. One reason for changing the size of the blocks is to reduce the block size if snapshots are taken more often.

snap_count.title: snapCount
snap_count.description: ZooKeeper logs transactions to a transaction log. After snapCount transactions are written to a log file a snapshot is started and a new transaction log file is created. The default snapCount is 100,000.

max_client_cnxns.title: maxClientCnxns
max_client_cnxns.description: Limits the number of concurrent connections (at the socket level) that a single client, identified by IP address, may make to a single member of the ZooKeeper ensemble. This is used to prevent certain classes of DoS attacks, including file descriptor exhaustion. The default is 60. Setting this to 0 entirely removes the limit on concurrent connections.

min_session_timeout.title: minSessionTimeout
min_session_timeout.description: the minimum session timeout in milliseconds that the server will allow the client to negotiate. Defaults to 2 times the tickTime.

max_session_timeout.title: maxSessionTimeout
max_session_timeout.description: the maximum session timeout in milliseconds that the server will allow the client to negotiate. Defaults to 20 times the tickTime.

fsync_warning_threshold_ms.title: fsync.warningthresholdms
fsync_warning_threshold_ms.description: A warning message will be output to the log whenever an fsync in the Transactional Log (WAL) takes longer than this value. The values is specified in milliseconds and defaults to 1000. This value can only be set as a system property.

autopurge_snap_retain_count.title: autopurge.snapRetainCount
autopurge_snap_retain_count.description: When enabled, ZooKeeper auto purge feature retains the autopurge.snapRetainCount most recent snapshots and the corresponding transaction logs in the dataDir and dataLogDir respectively and deletes the rest. Minimum value is 3.

autopurge_purge_interval.title: autopurge.purgeInterval
autopurge_purge_interval.description: The time interval in hours for which the purge task has to be triggered. Set to a positive integer (1 and above) to enable the auto purging. Defaults to 0.

leader_serves.title: leaderServes
leader_serves.description: Leader accepts client connections. Default value is yes. The leader machine coordinates updates. For higher update throughput at thes slight expense of read throughput the leader can be configured to not accept clients and focus on coordination. The default to this option is yes, which means that a leader will accept client connections.

cnx_timeout.title: cnxTimeout
cnx_timeout.description: Sets the timeout value for opening connections for leader election notifications. Only applicable if you are using electionAlg 3. Default value is 5 seconds
